omq.common.broker

Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • omq.common.broker.Broker

  • public class Broker
extends java.lang.Object
    A "broker" allows a new connection to a RabbitMQ server. Under this connection it can have binded object and proxies.
    Author:
    Sergi Toda

      • lookupMulti

        public <T extends Remote> T lookupMulti(java.lang.String reference,
                               java.lang.Class<T> contract)
                             throws RemoteException
        Returns the remote object for specified reference. This function returns an special type of proxy, every method invoked will be multi and asynchronous.
        Parameters:
        reference - - Binding name
        contract - - Remote Interface
        Returns:
        newProxy
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • bind

        public void bind(java.lang.String reference,
        RemoteObject remote)
          throws RemoteException,
                 AlreadyBoundException
        Binds the reference to the specified remote object. This function uses the broker's environment
        Parameters:
        reference - - Binding name
        remote - - RemoteObject to bind
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If the remote operation failed
        AlreadyBoundException - If name is already bound.

      • bind

        public void bind(java.lang.String reference,
        RemoteObject remote,
        java.util.Properties env)
          throws RemoteException,
                 AlreadyBoundException
        Binds the reference to the specified remote object. This function uses the broker's environment
        Parameters:
        reference - - Binding name
        remote - - RemoteObject to bind
        env - - RemoteObject environment. You can set how many threads will be listen to the reference, the multiqueue name and the properties of the object queue and multiqueue
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If the remote operation failed
        AlreadyBoundException - If name is already bound.

      • unbind

        public void unbind(java.lang.String reference)
            throws RemoteException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Unbinds a remoteObject from its reference and kills all the threads created.
        Parameters:
        reference - - Binding name
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If the remote operation failed
        java.io.IOException - If there are problems while killing the threads

        Throws:
